attributes.title: Stock verification
attributes.description:
Findings;

·       A stock take exercise was conducted on 08.04.25 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets.

·       The following were the stock findings;

Ø  Bread variance- Brown bread- (-47.75 loaves)

                         -White bread-   (-16.75 loaves)

Ø  Sweet bread premix- (+1 bag)

Ø  Polybags-  (+139 pieces)

Summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: Manager to improve follow-up on bread posting to curb variances in the raw materials.
attributes.effect: Variances noted is an indication that stock controls are not effective.

value: I will initiate corrective measures to ensure that raw materials movement is correctly recorded.
Improvement measures will be implemented.
In the previous audit findings; Bread shortfall was 1,048 loaves and polybags had a variance of +2,889 pcs. Notable variances in raw materials were also identified.

attributes.title: Bread weight
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        Sample varieties of packed bread were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.

·        Most of the sample varieties conform to the standard weight.

·        The underweight samples were spread as follows; 200g W- 05%, 400g W- 0%, 600g W- 0% and 800g W- 0%.

The table below summarizes the findings
attributes.recommendation: Weight controls should be maintained
attributes.effect: ·        Most of the sample bread conform to the standard weight indicating that production standards are being observed.

value: The positive trend will be maintained.
Minimal cases of underweight were noted in the previous audit spot check.

attributes.title: Damages Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        Analysis of bread damages from 01.03.25 – 07.04.25 was done to verify if the level of bread damages was maintained within the set limits of 0.25% of the total production and 0.2% of the total sales.

·        A total of 1,220.5 loaves were damaged under production damages which represent 0.31% of the total loaves produced.

·        1,719.5 loaves were damaged under market damages (market returns and expired bread) representing 0.44% of the total sales over the audited period.

·        Both production and market damages exceeded the set limits by a total of 1,183 loaves worth Ksh. 63,291

Below is a summary table of the findings
attributes.recommendation: ·        Branch management to ensure that damages are maintained within the set limits.
attributes.effect: Excess bread damages worth Ksh. 63,291 is an indication that the company is exposed to losses due to excess bread damages.

value: This is noted and improvement measures will be initiated.

attributes.title: Mixing  charts analysis
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        Comparison of manual mixing charts and the system mixing charts was done from 01.03.25 – 07.08.25 to assess the adherence to production standards and verify the accuracy of production data.

·        There was no material variance between system and the actual material usage.

·        No significant variance in bread posting was noted over the audited period.

Below are the summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: The branch should continue observing the set production standards.
attributes.effect: Production standards were observed.

value: ·        We will maintain.
No variances was reported in the previous audit findings.

attributes.title: Cash verification
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        A spot check was done on cash office to verify if the branch cash was well maintained.

·        No material variances were noted on the spot-check day.
attributes.recommendation: The branch should ensure that patty cash records and balances are well maintained.
attributes.effect: ·        No material variance was noted between physical cash and book balance, an indication that   effective controls are in place.

value: The positive trend will be maintained.
No variances were reported in the cash office in the previous audit findings.

attributes.title: Production Efficiency
attributes.description:
·        The branch hired a total of 402 production workers over the audited period hence the expected production was 1,809 bags.

·        The actual production was 1,978 bags leading to an actual efficiency of 4.9 bags per worker.

·        The set efficiency was achieved

Production efficiency
attributes.recommendation: Proper planning of workers should be maintained.
attributes.effect: The set production efficiency was not attained indicating that the planned labour cost was observed.

attributes.title: Packaging Efficiency
attributes.description:
1.     Packaging Efficiency

Findings;

·        Packaging efficiency was analyzed from 01.03.25 – 07.04.25 to find out if the branch achieved the set target of 97 crates per worker.

·        The total bread produced over the audited period is 29,086 crates hence the expected slicers to be hired was 300 workers.

·        A total of 305 workers were hired leading to a packaging efficiency of 95.4 crates per worker which is slightly below the target.

·        Extra 5 packers were hired over the audit period and the set packaging efficiency was not achieved.
attributes.recommendation: Management to improve on the planning of slicing workers to ensure that the set efficiency is consistently achieved.
attributes.effect: The set packaging efficiency was not achieved indicating that the planned packaging cost was exceeded

attributes.description:
Analysis of fuel consumption by the delivery vehicles was done for the month of March 2025 to verify if their consumption rate is within the set standards.

No material variance between the actual fuel usage and the set rates.
attributes.recommendation: The set controls on fuel usage should be strictly adhered.
attributes.effect: Fuel consumption rates are within the range indicating that fuel controls are being observed.

value: We will continue to observe the effective controls

attributes.title: Generator Fuel Analysis
attributes.description: ·  Analysis of fuel consumption by the generator was done for the month of March 2025 to verify if its consumption rate is within the set standards.
attributes.recommendation: Fuel controls should continue to be adhered.
attributes.effect: Fuel consumption rates are within the range indicating that fuel controls are being observed.
